title: Explain via Any Concept: Concept Bottleneck Model with Open Vocabulary Concepts
details: A Tan, F Zhou, H Chen - arXiv preprint arXiv:2408.02265, 2024
abstract: The concept bottleneck model (CBM) is an interpretable-by-design framework that makes decisions by first predicting a set of interpretable concepts, and then predicting the class label based on the given concepts. Existing CBMs are trained …

title: Hierarchical Debiasing and Noisy Correction for Cross-domain Video Tube Retrieval
details: J Xiu, M Li, W Ji, J Chen, H Zhao, S Satoh… - ACM Multimedia 2024
abstract: Video Tube Retrieval (VTR) has attracted wide attention in the multi-modal domain, aiming to accurately localize the spatial-temporal tube in videos based on the natural language description. Despite the remarkable progress, existing VTR models trained …

title: Diffusion Models as Data Mining Tools
details: I Siglidis, A Holynski, AA Efros, M Aubry, S Ginosar - arXiv preprint arXiv:2408.02752, 2024
abstract: This paper demonstrates how to use generative models trained for image synthesis as tools for visual data mining. Our insight is that since contemporary generative models learn an accurate representation of their training data, we can use them to …
